alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Saunders; Washington (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 12 at 6:14PM CDT until May 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...CENTRAL DODGE AND NORTH CENTRAL SAUNDERS COUNTIES... At 614 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Cedar Bluffs, or 8 miles west of Fremont, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Fremont around 620 PM CDT. Nickerson around 635 PM CDT. Hooper around 645 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Camp Eagle, Camp Cedars, Fremont Lakes State Recreation Area, Winslow and Ames. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
